property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: Local Pakistanis waiting to be evacuated after a flood

note.text: In Pakistan, humanitarian needs vary by province. Earthquakes are common in the north and west, while floods and droughts occur seasonally along the Indus River. Poverty, frequent terrorist attacks, and the presence of millions of displaced people and refugees are issues throughout the country.

Taking the time to learn about the region will greatly increase your understanding of the specific humanitarian situation. Consider the local perspective and standard of living, rather than those of the U.S., when developing solutions.
